intro: Dichrocephala chrysanthemifolia var. chrysanthemifolia, commonly known as the golden chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine. Its botanical structure supports its adaptability to diverse environmental conditions.
